description.content: We provided payment methods configuration that allow our sellers to configure installment options and from that configuration we generate an installment service.
Returns the best installment options according to the informed params.
(Required)
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
(Required) The AppKey configured by the merchant (optional configuration)
(Required) The AppToken configured by the merchant (optional configuration)
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
(Required) The AppKey configured by the merchant (optional configuration)
(Required) The AppToken configured by the merchant (optional configuration)
(Required) The Media type of the body of the request.  Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json
(Required) Media type(s) that is/are acceptable for the response. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

description.content: This is meant to explain the requests that are necessary to complete a transaction using PCI Gateway.
This request is the first step to create a new transaction.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
(Required) The AppKey configured by the merchant (optional configuration)

The third step to create a new transaction. It will send the additional related data to the transaction, like billig and shipping adress.

This step is used to send identify user profile, shopping cart, shipping data used in most antifraud systems.
(Required) Transaction identification.
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
(Required) The AppKey configured by the merchant (optional configuration)
(Required) The AppToken configured by the merchant (optional configuration)

(Required) Media type(s) that is/are acceptable for the response. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json
(Required) The Media type of the body of the request.  Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

The fourth and last step to create a new transaction. It will authorized the new transaction creation according to the data previously informed in the latests requests.

This step is the trigger to process each of payments that were received in step 2.

Each payment will be sent to acquirer. If all payments are authorized, the transaction will be authorized. If one of the payments is denied, all payments in transaction will be cancelled.

After one transaction is authorized, there is remaining to do some calls in order to complete a transaction and its payments. We explain the settle process, cancel authorized payments process, and refund process by using examples.

Settles transaction's value. Settle an authorized transaction REST call is mandatory in order to complete a transaction and its payments.

A payment settled means that the seller will receive the value of the purchase after bank conciliation.
(Required)
Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL
(Required) The AppKey configured by the merchant (optional configuration)
(Required) The AppToken configured by the merchant (optional configuration)
(Required)

(Required) Media type(s) that is/are acceptable for the response. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json
(Required) The Media type of the body of the request.  Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

Refunds transaction's value that was previously settled.

After a settled transaction this REST call is allowed, it is possible to refund partially or complete the transaction value.

Due to acquirer rules it is not possible to execute this step online against the acquirer, and if and error occurrs, we notify the seller company responsible via email to verify manually the transaction status against the acquirer.
(Required)

Cancel's transaction that was previously approved, but not settled.

It is possible to cancel partially or complete value of the transaction.

Due to acquirer rules it is not possible to execute this step online against the acquirer.

>ℹ️ Onboarding guide
>
> Check the new [Payments onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/payments-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Payments and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

The Payments Gateway API allows you to get payment data and process your store's transactions.
